name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
[Fudan University professor threatened with U-shaped lock, criticized and beaten to death on the spot, and banned from speaking for 15 days]
On September 9, Yan Feng, a famous blogger and professor of Chinese at Fudan University, was threatened on Weibo. One user said he would use a U-shaped lock to hit Yan Feng and cause concussion, and another user said he would beat Yan Feng to death on the spot. It is said that this user is a student of the School of Law at Jilin University.
However, what is shocking is that not only did the netizens' complaints against the two users who threatened him fail, but Yan Feng himself was banned from speaking for 15 days.
This shows the domestic public opinion environment.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Yan Feng posted a microblog: "What are you afraid of? I'm afraid you will relive the origin of "The Three-Body Problem"".
In "The Three-Body Problem" written by Liu Cixin, the origin of the story is that the heroine's father was severely criticized during the Cultural Revolution, which eventually led to the heroine's complete disappointment with humans and sent the coordinates of the earth to aliens, which led to the earth being occupied by aliens and humans being enslaved.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
ã€Welcoming the Asian Games, official media collectively "proposed anti-poems"ã€‘
On September 11, led by the People's Daily, official media from all over the country collectively released "On Lin'an Residence" in the name of "See Hangzhou with the Text":
There are green mountains outside the mountains and buildings outside the buildings. When will the singing and dancing in West Lake stop?

The warm wind makes tourists drunk, and they mistake Hangzhou for Bianzhou.

This poem by Lin Sheng, a poet of the Southern Song Dynasty, satirizes the despicable behavior of those in power who ignore the future and destiny of the country, indulge in drunkenness and dreams, and disregard the national economy and people's livelihood through the description of the scenery of Hangzhou and the comparison between "Hangzhou" and "Bianzhou".

The poem is included in elementary school textbooks.

At present, the entire topic has been collectively banned by Weibo and Baidu

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On September 11, the district police station asked the enterprises in the area to vote and like the article "Whose cake has been touched by Article 34 of the Public Security Administration Punishment Law (Draft Amendment) and whose defense has been broken?" in its work contact group on the public account "Ye Ping" and asked them to report it within the specified time.
In fact, there is no essential difference between the two voting options.
Netizens judged that this move may be to start public opinion building for the strong promotion of the law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: It is reported that it is not uncommon for such official accounts to pretend to be personal accounts and call on all members of the system to forward or mobilize companies to forward or vote. First, it plays a propaganda role, second, it provides public opinion data, and third, the large amount of traffic and clicks forcibly created by administrative power can reasonably obtain huge advertising traffic revenue from the platform, which is an excellent means of generating income. The following are the official vest accounts summarized by netizens before
